item.title: Brett add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Brett add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "The work of an intellectual is not to mould the political will of others; it is, through the analyses that he does in his own field, to re-examine evidence and assumptions, to shake up habitual ways of working and thinking, to dissipate conventional familiarities, to re-evaluate rules and institutions and to participate in the formation of a political will (where he has his role as citizen to play)." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Brett add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Brett add a quote by Seth Godin
item.description: "Change almost never fails because it's too early. It almost always fails because it's too late." -- Seth Godin

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "All religions are true but none are literal." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Half the people in the world think that the metaphors of their religious traditions, for example, are facts. And the other half contends that they are not facts at all. As a result we have people who consider themselves believers because they accept metaphors as facts, and we have others who classify themselves as atheists because they think religious metaphors are lies." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "You must give up the life you planned in order to have the life that is waiting for you.” –" -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "I don't like work--no man does--but I like what is in the work--the chance to find yourself. Your own reality--for yourself not for others--what no other man can ever know. They can only see the mere show, and never can tell what it really means." -- Joseph Conrad
